Articles.Content: Hi I have a question about the Kraken bug, it had nothing mentioned about it in the big bad bugs,
What is the question? And what is RAD 2? And "Kraken" is a pretty generic term for bugs in KSP, to which bug do you refer?
General Kraken 0.17-. RAD (Rapid Unplanned Disassembly) hope this helps!
Still waiting for the question...or description of the problem.

1 hour ago, Red Iron Crown said:

Still waiting for the question...or description of the problem.

My question is is there a possibility of the spacecraft ripping itself apart on the PS4? Like the kraken bug from 0.17, which on the pc to is the deep space cthulu. Now is that enough?

1 minute ago, KerbalXcer said:

My question is is there a possibility of the spacecraft ripping itself apart on the PS4? Like the kraken bug from 0.17, which on the pc to is the deep space cthulu. Now is that enough?

Ah, the original deep space kraken bug. That was fixed long ago with something called "krakensbane", which involves centering the coordinate system on the root part of the craft rather than the parent body (this greatly reduces floating point precision/rounding errors that were the cause of the problem). This fix is in all branches of KSP.

That said, there can be other causes for a craft disassembling itself, sometimes SAS can cause a harmonic wobble that will tear the ship apart. Is that what you are observing?
No, I was just wanting to know if it was there, but thanks!
